summary: This document is a letter from the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator of the Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch to a warden, regarding the scheduling and logistical preparation for a 'Psychological Reconstruction' for inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It details the materials needed, staff assistance required, and travel arrangements for the visiting team.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The inmate for whom a Psychological Reconstruction is being scheduled by the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: National Suicide Prevention Coordinator
persons.role: National Suicide Prevention Coordinator, Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch

connections.description: The Coordinator is organizing a Psychological Reconstruction for inmate Epstein.
The Administrator will be part of the team conducting the Psychological Reconstruction for inmate Epstein.
They are working together as a team to conduct the Psychological Reconstruction.

events.title: Scheduling of Psychological Reconstruction for Epstein
events.description: The National Suicide Prevention Coordinator informs a warden about the upcoming scheduling for a Psychological Reconstruction for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, detailing logistical preparations.

keyFacts: The Federal Bureau of Prisons was scheduling a 'Psychological Reconstruction' for inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
The visiting team from the Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch planned to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca in New York.
The reconstruction was expected to take place over three days, from a Tuesday to a Thursday.
The process required gathering documents and conducting staff interviews, with assistance requested from the institution's SIS department or a lieutenant.
The correspondence highlights the bureaucratic and procedural steps taken by the BOP regarding Epstein while in custody.
